DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether daily prenatal supplement iron plus folic acid daily prenatal supplement multiple vitamins mineral give woman first prenatal visit delivery reduce perinatal mortality compare daily prenatal supplement folic acid alone .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Prenatal Vitamin/Mineral Supplements Perinatal Mortality
DOC.detailed_description: In project area China , rate perinatal mortality ( stillbirths infant death within 6 day birth ) two time United States . Causes perinatal mortality include , limited , low birth weight preterm delivery . Anemia ( low hemoglobin ) among pregnant woman associate low birth weight preterm delivery also elevate project area . Supplements iron , folic acid , vitamins mineral prevent anemia among pregnant woman , effect supplement maternal infant health outcome unclear . Since 1993 , People 's Republic China recommend newly marry woman , plan pregnancy , take 400μg folic acid daily first trim pregnancy . Although WHO recommend pregnant woman take iron folic acid supplement , currently national recommendation pregnant woman China take iron vitamin mineral supplement ( folic acid ) . UNICEF test prenatal vitamin mineral supplement program prevent low birth weight . Our study provide additional information health impact UNICEF prenatal supplement versus iron folic acid supplement versus folic acid alone . Comparisons : - Infants woman receive daily prenatal supplement contain 400μg folic acid alone , compare infant woman receive daily supplement contain 30 mg iron 400 μg folic acid . - Infants woman receive daily supplement contain 30 mg iron 400 μg folic acid compare infant woman receive daily supplement contain 30 mg iron , 400μg folic acid vitamin mineral ( UNICEF formulation ) .
DOC.criteria: Live one study county ( Laoting , Mancheng , Fengrun , Xianghe , Yuanshi ) Can follow instruction Can swallow pill > = 20 week gestation enrollment Previous live birth Anemic ( hemoglobin [ Hb ] < 10 g/dl 1st trimester < 9.5 g/dl 2nd trimester ) enrollment Current use iron vitamin mineral supplement ( except folic acid ) Age < 20 year enrollment Under treatment anemia enrollment Refuse participate
